availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Jeremiah Rogers Halderman (Fayette County, KY, physician)

body.p: Fayette County, Kentucky, physician. New Orleans, Louisiana native. Married to Rachael B. Halderman. Father of John B. Halderman, George B. Halderman, and Mary B. Halderman. Physician in Fayette County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, District 1, p. 454.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Orleans Parish, New Orleans Ward 10, p. 171A.
Oaths and Bonds of Administration, 1855-1889, Avoyelles Parish (Louisiana), September 20, 1876, p. 123 of microfilm (accessed via Ancestry.com, March 20, 2020).
